Package controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.Controller
  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller is the class that links the graphical interface of the chat with the echo client that communicates with the server. A controller is composed of :
    • A Landing Page where the user will choose its username.
    • An EchoClient which will communicate with the server and exchange messages.
    Author:
    Camille Migozzi and Karina Du
    See Also:
    EchoClient, LandingPage

      • createChat

        public void createChat​(java.lang.String username)
        Create a Chat the graphical interface for the user to enter messages and see its received messages. Create an Echo Listener that will exchange messages with the server.
        Parameters:
        username - String of the username chose by the user.
        See Also:
        Chat, EchoClient

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage​(java.lang.String message)
        Send a message written by the user in the GUI to the EchoClient.
        Parameters:
        message - String of the message written by the user.
        See Also:
        EchoClient

      • receiveMessage

        public void receiveMessage​(java.lang.String message)
        Receive a message from the EchoClient in the GUI to display it for the user.
        Parameters:
        message - String of the message received.
        See Also:
        EchoClient

      • leaveChat

        public void leaveChat()
        Leave the chat, it will disconnect the EchoClient.
        See Also:
        EchoClient

      • addGroup

        public void addGroup​(java.lang.String newGroupName,
                     java.lang.String newGroupMembers,
                     java.lang.String username)
        Add a chat group created by the user.
        Parameters:
        newGroupName - String of the name of the group.
        newGroupMembers - String of all the usernames of the member.
        username - String of the username creator of the group.
        See Also:
        EchoClient

        See Also:
